Description: Cast from a Greek metal relief of the 3rd century B.C.Below, youth with phiale and cornucopia, seated woman crowned by flying Eros, woman with cornucopiaAbove, stars and caps of the DioskouroiThe plaster reliefs displayed in this case likely served as models for Roman copies of Greek metalware. Such casts undoubtedly also inspired other kinds of Roman works, including intaglios, relief-decorated stone sarcophagi, and terracotta lamps.
